common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Unresponsive or Returning Errors
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot being unresponsive, returning errors, or generating no output. Issues are linked to outdated OpenAI API keys, problems with Claude and Gemini models, and rate limiting. Solutions include removing OpenAI keys, switching to GPT4o, updating Pieces OS, and signing in to increase rate limits.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* `bschwenk` reported an issue with context when using Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o. 
* `mark-at-pieces` identified two issues: file inclusion in context and line number wrapping.

**Problems Identified:**

* Gemini was not recognizing the provided file.
* Line numbers were wrapping incorrectly.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* `mark-at-pieces` and `sam-at-pieces` investigated the file inclusion issue and provided a fix.
* `mack-at-pieces` was requested to investigate the line number wrapping issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The file inclusion issue is resolved and will be released in Pieces version 11.0.4.
* The line number wrapping issue is still under investigation.

**Additional Notes:**

* `bschwenk` thanked the team for their help.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate Pieces team member.
* Related issues and resources were provided to `bschwenk`.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Multiple users were experiencing issues with the functionality of the product. 
* These issues were likely caused by outdated OpenAI API keys, problems with the Claude and Gemini models, and/or insufficient rate limits.

**Problems Identified:**

* Users' OpenAI API keys were invalidating over time.
* Claude and Gemini models were experiencing issues.
* Users were exceeding rate limits.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Removing OpenAI API keys and switching to the GPT4o model.
* Updating to version 11.0.3 and signing in to Pieces to increase rate limits.
* Switching to an OpenAI model due to ongoing issues with Claude and Gemini.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Removing the OpenAI API key resolved the issue for some users. 
* The underlying cause of the OpenAI API key issue requires further investigation.
* The status of the Claude and Gemini models is unclear. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation indicates that the issue may not be fully resolved and further investigation is needed. 
* Users experiencing issues are advised to remove their OpenAI API keys and switch to the GPT4o model for the time being.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues in Remote Environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from VS Code in remote environments, such as WSL2 and DevContainers. This is often due to network configuration issues, particularly with Pieces OS listening on the loopback interface. Solutions include configuring custom URLs, adjusting WSL2 network settings, and upgrading to the latest Pieces for VS Code extension (2.0.2 or later) which includes a patch to address this issue.

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: 

**Key points:**

* Potential network issue within WSL2 causing connection problems
* Systemd flag in wsl.conf enabled, mirroring networking mode
* Pieces VSCode extension can connect but Copilot rendering fails
* Snap installation suspected as a possible cause

**Identified problems:**

* Network connectivity issues preventing Copilot rendering
* Cause of issue remains unclear, potentially WSL2 or snap-related

**Proposed solutions:**

* Enable dns-tunnel within WSL2
* Investigate snap installation as a potential factor

**Current status/outcome:**

* Investigation ongoing, further updates expected

**Additional notes:**

* Issue appears specific to the Pieces environment
* Systemd and mirroring networking mode enabled within WSL2 configuration

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * Malanciault reported an issue connecting to Pieces OS from a VS Code DevContainer. * The initial troubleshooting steps suggested by the Pieces support bot were not helpful. * Robert, a Pieces team member, identified that a networking change in the latest Pieces OS version (11.0.0) caused the issue. * The server's default listening interface was changed to loopback, preventing connections from the DevContainer. **Problems Identified:** * Updated documentation did not reflect the change in the default listening port. * Pieces Server could not listen to the provided address due to the loopback restriction. * Host.docker.internal resolution caused issues with Webview tool windows. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Robert suggested setting the custom URL to "http://192.168.0.129:39300" as a temporary workaround. * A more complex workaround involving DNS name entry was also proposed. * A patch was developed to allow the Pieces Server to listen on all interfaces. * This patch was released in version 2.0.1 of the Pieces for VSCode extension. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue was resolved with the release of extension version 2.0.2. * Malanciault confirmed that the issue was fixed after upgrading to the latest version. **Additional Notes:** * This issue highlights the importance of keeping documentation up-to-date with software changes. * It also demonstrates the value of clear communication and collaboration between users and developers in resolving technical problems.

**Next Steps:**

* User needs to provide logs or schedule a call for further diagnosis.
* If the development build resolves the issue, the user should uninstall it and reinstall the production version.

common_issues.title: Desktop App Bugs on macOS
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported various bugs on the Pieces Desktop App for macOS, including issues with conversation titles saving prematurely, repetitive welcome messages, and Copilot malfunctions. Solutions varied from patches in upcoming releases to ongoing investigations by the Pieces team.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Search and Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS search not returning results or getting stuck. Solutions involve clarifying search functionality, planned upgrades, and investigating logs for connection problems.

related_issues.title: Neural Code Search returns no results
related_issues.text:
Neural Code Search returns no results
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have four materials entered since a few days ago and NCS type search never returns anything.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cea82b95-b382-45f3-8777-227d3abd2269)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/175e6117-9ef6-49c0-94f2-26812b788080)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @hovek reported an issue with Pieces' search functionality.
* Support bot acknowledged the issue and provided resources.
* @mark-at-pieces explained the different search methods available in Pieces: NCS, FTS, and Blended.
* @mark-at-pieces identified the need for a search upgrade in Pieces.
* A major search upgrade was planned for the end of the quarter (presumably Q1 2025).

**Problems Identified:**

* The user experienced confusion with Pieces' search functionality.
* Existing search was deemed inadequate by both the user and @mark-at-pieces.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces clarified the different search methods and their functionalities.
* A major search upgrade was planned for the future.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* No resolution was immediately implemented.
* A major search upgrade was planned for a future date.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place in January 2025.
* It is currently November 2023, so the planned search upgrade may have already been implemented.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch, consuming excessive RAM/CPU, or getting stuck on "connecting." Proposed solutions include restarting the app, checking internet connection, and disabling resource-intensive features. The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues and encourages users to share their experiences and logs for troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue: PiecesOS High Resource Usage

**Key Points Raised:**

* PiecesOS uses a significant amount of RAM and CPU resources, especially on some configurations.
* Resource usage can spike unexpectedly, even when not actively using the tool.
* Concerns about resource usage leading to slowdowns and potential security risks (mining).

**Problems Identified:**

* Memory leak causing unexpectedly high RAM usage.
* High CPU usage without clear correlation to specific functionalities.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Memory optimization option within PiecesOS interface.
* Continuous efforts to improve overall memory and CPU performance.
* "Live Context" feature identified as a potential contributor to higher resource usage.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Resource usage issue ongoing with no permanent solutions yet implemented.
* Users report mixed experiences, with some experiencing significant performance issues.
* PiecesOS team acknowledges the problem and is actively working on improvements.

**Additional Notes:**

* Resource usage appears to vary depending on hardware configurations and user activity.
* Workarounds like disabling features ("Live Context") and restarting the software can temporarily reduce resource usage.
* PiecesOS team encourages users to report their specific experiences and configurations for further investigation.

related_issues.title: Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
related_issues.text:
Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

version: 8.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Issue:**
I am encountering difficulties with installing and launching the Pieces Windows desktop version. After a successful installation, the software fails to open properly. Despite confirming its presence in the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Download and install the Pieces Windows desktop version.
- Attempt to launch the software.
- Observe that the program does not open on the screen.
- Check the task manager to confirm the software is running in the background.

**Expected Behavior:**
Upon installation, the Pieces Windows desktop version should launch and display its interface on the screen, allowing users to interact with it

**Actual Behavior:**
After installation, the software does not open as expected. Despite running in the background according to the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**System Information:**

- Windows version: 22H2 (OS Build 19045)

**Additional Notes:**
I have attempted to troubleshoot this issue without success. Any assistance or insights into resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Pieces OS Launch Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS from the Pieces Suite and the Start Menu.
* The issue seems to be specific to Pieces OS, as Pieces for Developers is working properly.
* Users have tried various troubleshooting steps, including updating Pieces and the Microsoft App Installer.
* The issue persists across different operating systems (Windows and macOS) and browsers (Chrome and Brave).

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS fails to launch when initiated through the Pieces Suite or Start Menu.
* The Pieces Chrome extension cannot connect to Pieces OS, even though it is installed and running.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No specific solutions have been proposed or implemented in the conversation thread.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved as of January 16, 2025.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests that the issue may be related to other reported problems with Pieces OS (see comments referencing issue #158 and #164).
* Users are encouraged to provide more information about their device and software versions to help diagnose the problem.

recommendations: **Prioritize Pieces Copilot Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the ongoing issues with Pieces Copilot, such as unresponsiveness, errors, and outdated API keys. This is the most frequent and impactful problem reported by users.

**Improve Remote Connection Stability:** Address the challenges users face when connecting to Pieces OS from remote environments like WSL2 and DevContainers. Ensure the documentation clearly outlines the necessary configuration steps and consider implementing auto-detection mechanisms to simplify the process.

**Enhance macOS Desktop App Experience:** Investigate and fix the reported bugs on the macOS Desktop App, including issues with conversation titles, welcome messages, and Copilot functionality. A smooth and bug-free experience on macOS is crucial for user satisfaction.

**Optimize Pieces OS Search:** Address the user feedback regarding Pieces OS search functionality. Improve the search algorithm to deliver more accurate and relevant results. Consider implementing features like search filters and query suggestions.

**Investigate and Address Performance Issues:** Dedicate resources to investigate and resolve the reported performance issues with PiecesOS, including high RAM/CPU usage, launch failures, and connection problems. Optimize the software to ensure smooth and efficient performance across different hardware configurations.

**Proactively Communicate Known Issues:** Maintain a dedicated section on the Pieces website or within the app itself to communicate known issues, workarounds, and expected resolution timelines. This will keep users informed and reduce support requests for already identified problems.

**Gather Detailed User Feedback:** Implement mechanisms to collect more detailed user feedback, including system information, logs, and steps to reproduce issues. This will empower the support team to diagnose and resolve problems more effectively.

**Expand Knowledge Base and Troubleshooting Guides:** Enhance the Pieces knowledge base and support documentation with comprehensive troubleshooting guides, FAQs, and video tutorials. This will empower users to self-serve and find solutions to common problems independently.
